content:
I'm happy to help! However, I need to clarify that I'm a large language model, I don't have personal experiences or interactions with you, your dog Max, or any pet supply stores. I'm here to provide general information and assist with your queries.

That being said, the duration of a 20-pound bag of dog food depends on several factors, including Max's age, breed, size, activity level, and individual appetite. Generally, a 20-pound bag of dog food can last anywhere from 4 to 8 weeks, depending on these factors.

To get a better estimate, you can consult with your veterinarian or the manufacturer's feeding guidelines. They can provide you with a more accurate calculation based on Max's specific needs.

Additionally, you can consider the following general guidelines:

* Small breeds (under 20 pounds): 1-2 cups per day
* Medium breeds (21-50 pounds): 2-3 cups per day
* Large breeds (51-80 pounds): 3-4 cups per day
* Giant breeds (over 80 pounds): 4-5 cups per day

Assuming an average daily consumption, you can estimate the duration of the 20-pound bag accordingly.

Remember to monitor Max's food intake, weight, and overall health, and adjust the feeding amount as needed. It's always better to err on the side of caution and consult with a veterinarian if you have any concerns.

I hope this helps, and I'm sure Max will enjoy his new grain-free diet!
